channel.title: A "pin logger"
channel.description:
Its a comparison of a key logger, but used for RS which would capture or log the bank pin of the targeted account. I've been reading recently of bank pins getting broken into still...
Now how is this happening?

item.dc:creator: @SpeedIsMeh SpeedIsMeh
item.description:
@SpeedIsMeh wrote:

iirc there’s a “setting” that holds the value of the pin entered so far

item.title: A "pin logger"
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“n3ss3s, post:15, topic:424374”]I made one and sold it for a little while, then released it for free. Basically what it does (did, graphics update broke it, cbf updating, not interested) is installs a global mousehook, then when a click occurs (and RuneScape is the active window), it checks if the pin screen is open, if so it located the positions of the digit buttons by the position of the corner of the pin screen (the pin window is the same size/proportions for all screen sizes), then grabs all the orange on the buttons and sorts them into digits by their densities (for doubles like 2, 3 and 6, 9 I checked the amount of points in the bottom row of the point array).

Stub source: http://pastebin.com/QQ5a8bCy (Yes, I’m x0riax)

Feel free to hate on me making it in C# and probable shitness to be found. Main reasons for C# are rather convinient WinAPI access and making a builder using CodeDOM is quite easy…

And yeah, this was definitely the “incorrect” and more painful way to do it, but I don’t know shit about java agents etc that I would’ve needed to be able to reflect the values…

EDIT: I didn’t make it with education in mind,

[quote]if (fuck)
digits[negind] = 45 - sum;[/quote]

so just ask if you’re interested in knowing what’s going on at some lines…[/quote]I did the same thing except it was a Javaagent and it just checked mouse input when the pin interface was up, and matched the subcomponents up with where you clicked, and grabbed whatever text was on the button you clicked.

Read full topic

item.title: A "pin logger"
item.dc:creator: @n3ss3s n3ss3s
item.description:
@n3ss3s wrote:

I made one and sold it for a little while, then released it for free. Basically what it does (did, graphics update broke it, cbf updating, not interested) is installs a global mousehook, then when a click occurs (and RuneScape is the active window), it checks if the pin screen is open, if so it located the positions of the digit buttons by the position of the corner of the pin screen (the pin window is the same size/proportions for all screen sizes), then grabs all the orange on the buttons and sorts them into digits by their densities (for doubles like 2, 3 and 6, 9 I checked the amount of points in the bottom row of the point array).

Stub source: http://pastebin.com/QQ5a8bCy (Yes, I’m x0riax)

Feel free to hate on me making it in C# and probable shitness to be found. Main reasons for C# are rather convinient WinAPI access and making a builder using CodeDOM is quite easy…

And yeah, this was definitely the “incorrect” and more painful way to do it, but I don’t know shit about java agents etc that I would’ve needed to be able to reflect the values…

EDIT: I didn’t make it with education in mind,

if (fuck) digits[negind] = 45 - sum;

so just ask if you’re interested in knowing what’s going on at some lines…

Read full topic

item.title: A "pin logger"
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:10, topic:424374”][quote author=veer link=topic=527030.msg3841155#msg3841155 date=1323236454]
Hook the method which handles mouse clicks, et voila.
[/quote]It randomizes the order of which the pins are aligned by row/column.

[quote author=Speljohan link=topic=527030.msg3840685#msg3840685 date=1323208340]

[quote author=Mopman link=topic=527030.msg3840683#msg3840683 date=1323208229]
tbh itd be trivial to do it even without taking pictures
[/quote]In fact, taking pictures would probably be harder.
[/quote]But its probably still done by taking pictures?[/quote]No, pictures would just be a waste. It’s completely unneccessary.

Read full topic

sub-PINterfaces

item.title: A "pin logger"
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

Davidi2:

I understand that, but it seems like people are implying you wouldn’t need to take pictures of the screen at all :o

You could also probably hook the child sub-PINterfaces, and get the pin that way. You could even make it only submit if the pin ended up being valid (i.e. bank interface was shown). This would be in a Java bot; using OpenGL etc it would essentially come down to pixel processing anyhow.

Read full topic

item.title: A "pin logger"
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

Davidi2:

I thought the numbers were put in random locations so that knowing which buttons they click wasn’t enough?

You could hook it to check if the PINterface is there and take a localized screenshot. This would be slightly harder than just recording it all, but at least you don’t have to sift through 9999 irrelevant crap.

Read full topic
